Author: cipi#4502
Content:
yes, very annoying... and i saw sites that are not even implementing it right... site is loading, but elements are missing
and if you use the developer tools of the browser you can see why: every request to those elements that don't show up get a 403 (unauthorized) and they are asking for the captcha stuff, but that is not visible on the main site, only in the developer tools
would love to see Google charging 1$ for each request to their captchas, then this will stop for sure üôÇ

Author: Mylo#8306
Content:
@xeonrider yes it's a smartchain.   if you sync it with 
```
https://github.com/KomodoPlatform/komodo/blob/master/src/assetchains.old#L44
```
that command will start it, once synced, 
```
https://github.com/Komodo-Cakeshop/komodo-in-a-box/blob/master/setup/cc/tokens.sh#L37
```
üëÜ will list the tokens created on KMDICE with your rpcuser/pass/port

and then getting info about a specific token created  it can be done with 
```
https://github.com/Komodo-Cakeshop/komodo-in-a-box/blob/master/setup/cc/tokens.sh#L76
```
using the token id.

Author: xeonrider#3120

Author: Mylo#8306
Content:
Not a pro dev.  Not a full time dev.  When I was younger i could code a bit in c++/java.  Web components are very useful.   Web is useful, and the javascript ecosystem is handy for prototypes but for production-level code, I‚Äôm not your man :)

There is a gaming-SDK currently being worked on.

If you‚Äôre going to make blackjack or any multiplayer gambling games, the CHIPS project is better for microtransactions between groups because of the network model of games (small groups of people).

If you‚Äôre going to build a platformer or rogue-like game, then using komodo and it‚Äôs token system will work for you.  All the calls are available by http RPC (not rest).   From a browser there is CORS limitation.   From standalone programs, no problem.

If you were to grab a game template from the unity asset store, adding token calls would be pretty trivial.

A lightweight P2P daemon is in development - this will likely replace needing to run a full node for taking advantage of the antara framework (application smarts on blockchain)

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: Seeing as you said you know ethereum, basically the lightweight nSPV daemon has all the functions of something like infura, but distributable in a small bundle (4MB memory, 500kB executable C code)
